= HIRLAM-7.3 Parameter List, GRIB Definition, Operational Data Archive at ECMWF =

=== HIRLAM forecast model output and reference data archive ===
The forecast model writes its primary output to history file (fcyyyymmdd_hh+lll), which is designed to be a complete snap shot of the model state described by HIRLAM model for a particular time point (in even hour). In addition, through specification of name-list NAMPPP, more model output including post-processing/diagnostic fields can be written out during the forecast model integration, such as those model diagnostics ( with suffix ''md'' such as fcyyyymmdd_hh+lllmd),  pressure and single level parameters for field verification and observation verification ( with suffix ''ve'' such as fcyyyymmdd_hh+lllve). In the tables below abbreviations used for the different file type are: fc=''history file'', fcmd=''diagnostics file'' and fcve=''verification file''. 

At the HIRLAM reference computer platform ECMWF, up till March 1, 2004, main results of a HIRLAM forecast cycle are archived into a tar file, ARyyyymmdd_hh.tar under ECFS. The files for verification (fc*ve) and the ascii file with verification results (ve*) , are collected into a second tar file, VEyyyymmdd_hh.tar. The lateral boundary files are stored into a third tar file, MFyyyymmdd_hh.tar, which is also archived. These files as well as other older archives can be found in ec:/rui/hirlam/RCRa

For the period after March 1 2004, the reference HIRLAM forecast as conducted operationally at FMI, RCRa, the data archives are maintained in untared form in the ECMWF's ECFS at address 
       ec:/rui/hirlam/RCRa/yyyy/mm/dd/hh    (March 1, 2004 - March 31, 2006) 
       ec:/hirlam/RCRa/yyyy/mm/dd/hh         (April 1, 2006 -  )

=== Surface subtypes ===

There are seven subtypes of surface variables in Hirlam 7.3:

|| subtype  || subtype name ||
|| 1 || sea or inland water ||
|| 2 || sea or inland ice ||
|| 3 || bare land ||
|| 4 || low vegetation ||
|| 5 || forest  ||
|| 6 || snow over open land, internal variable ||
|| 7 || snow over forest, internal variable  ||

=== Near-surface state and diagnostic variables for subtypes ===

=== Three-dimensional tendencies due to physical parametrizations ===

In addition to the variables listed above, it is possible to request output of the components of dT/dt, dq/dt, dcw/dt, du/dt, dv/dt and dk/dt (k=resolved kinetic energy diagnosed from u and v) due to physical parametrizations, i.e. radiation, turbulence and condensation, accumulated from the analysis time to the forecast valid time. Tendencies of cloud ice and TKE are not available.
